FILE: cm471481v11.0.txt
DYAD: CAMEROON - GABON
RIVALRY: RIV1082
DISPUTE(S): MID1339 

PS-NOTES:

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20180707
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20180707

PS-NOTES:

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20180707
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20180930

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID1339

TERRMID: MID1339 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID1339 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1339 from Gibler 2018, in 1976, what were probably Cameroonian soldiers or policemen fired rockets at a Gabonese border outpost, killing several. Gabon closed its border until talks with Cameroon defused the tensions. Coded not territory because the border was not disputed at this time. 

TERRLINK: MID1339 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1339 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1339 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1339 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1339 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1339 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1339 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1339 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1339 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1339 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID1339 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1339 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1339 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1339 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:
Gabon re-opened its border with Cameroon on December 2, 1976.

SOURCES-CM: 
*Africa Research Bulletin* (ARB), December 1-31, 1976.

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield.
